scan_table_check.description: Credentials - i.e. user names and passwords must never be stored in a source control system repository. As an application file, an LDAP Server Config record may also be committed to a repository - and hence must not contain any credentials. The design of LDAP Server Config record implies that credentials are story within the record - which makes it impossible to separate logic and data (credentials in that case).
scan_table_check.name: CodeSanity - LDAP Server Configs must not contain credentials
scan_table_check.resolution_details: In order to make use of LDAP Server Config in an application that is maintained in a source control system, the required credentials must be added to the record before the LDAP Server is used for data import and then removed afterwards. Specifically the record must not contain any credentials when it is committed to source control.
scan_table_check.short_description: An LDAP Server Config record must not contain credentials
scan_table_check.sys_name: CodeSanity - LDAP Server Configs must not contain credentials
